metadata.data_source: HWCO historical data vs Lyft competitor analysis

primary_goals.strategy: Implement surge pricing, optimize location/time pricing
Optimize unit price without losing customers
Real-time competitor price monitoring and adjustment
Loyalty program enhancements, Gold tier protection

location_based.name: Urban Premium Pricing
location_based.description: Urban routes are underpriced by 14.9% vs Lyft. Increase urban pricing to capture value.

expected_impact.rationale: Lyft charges $417.97 avg vs HWCO $363.67 for Urban. Room to increase.

location_based.name: Rural Competitive Pricing
location_based.description: Rural routes are overpriced by 13.4% vs Lyft. Reduce to stay competitive.

expected_impact.rationale: Lyft charges $329 vs HWCO $379.94. We're losing rural customers.

location_based.name: Suburban Maintain Pricing
location_based.description: Suburban pricing is competitive (<1% difference). Maintain current rates.

expected_impact.rationale: Already competitive. Focus on volume.

time_based.name: Morning Rush Surge
time_based.description: Morning (6-10 AM) is underpriced by 11.6% vs Lyft. Apply surge pricing.

expected_impact.rationale: Lyft charges $421.90 vs HWCO $378.06. High commute demand.

time_based.name: Evening Rush Surge
time_based.description: Evening (5-9 PM) is underpriced by 12.9% vs Lyft. Apply surge pricing.

expected_impact.rationale: Lyft charges $411.32 vs HWCO $364.25. Peak demand period.

time_based.name: Afternoon Off-Peak Discount
time_based.description: Afternoon (11 AM-5 PM) can be priced competitively. Lyft is 11% lower.

expected_impact.rationale: Lyft charges $338.87 vs HWCO $380.82. Capture off-peak volume.

time_based.name: Night Steady Pricing
time_based.description: Night pricing is competitive (<1% difference). Maintain but monitor.

expected_impact.rationale: HWCO $367.01 vs Lyft $368.32. Already competitive.

loyalty_based.name: Gold Customer Protection
loyalty_based.description: Protect Gold customers from excessive surge pricing to reduce churn.

expected_impact.rationale: Lyft has 45.4% Gold vs HWCO 31.3%. Must retain premium customers.

loyalty_based.name: Silver Upgrade Incentive
loyalty_based.description: Encourage Silver to Gold conversion with slight discount and perks.

action.upgrade_bonus: Free upgrade to Gold after 50 rides

expected_impact.rationale: Silver pays 3.4% less at Lyft. Small discount encourages loyalty.

loyalty_based.name: Regular Customer Premium
loyalty_based.description: Regular customers pay market rate. No discount, but no penalty.

expected_impact.rationale: Lyft charges 12.3% more to Regular. Room for conversion incentives.

demand_based.name: High Demand Surge
demand_based.description: When demand exceeds supply by 40%+, apply surge pricing.

expected_impact.rationale: HWCO has 36.7% HIGH demand vs only 43.8% supply. Major opportunity.

demand_based.name: Medium Demand Standard
demand_based.description: Medium demand - apply light surge if supply is constrained.

expected_impact.rationale: 45.4% of rides are MEDIUM demand. Light optimization.

demand_based.name: Low Demand Discount
demand_based.description: Low demand periods - offer discounts to increase volume.

expected_impact.rationale: Only 17.9% of HWCO rides are LOW demand. Opportunity to grow.

pricing_model_optimization.name: Increase CONTRACTED Adoption
pricing_model_optimization.description: Push more customers to CONTRACTED pricing for predictable revenue.

expected_impact.rationale: Lyft has 56.1% CONTRACTED. Predictable pricing = loyal customers.

pricing_model_optimization.name: Reduce CUSTOM Pricing
pricing_model_optimization.description: Minimize CUSTOM pricing which is unpredictable and inefficient.

action.strategy: Convert CUSTOM to STANDARD with volume discounts

expected_impact.rationale: Lyft has only 1.1% CUSTOM. Too much CUSTOM = revenue leakage.

pricing_model_optimization.name: STANDARD Optimization
pricing_model_optimization.description: Optimize STANDARD pricing to maximize revenue per ride.

expected_impact.rationale: Lyft charges $415.27 vs HWCO $365.44 for STANDARD. Significant gap.

vehicle_based.name: Premium Vehicle Surge
vehicle_based.description: Premium vehicles should command higher prices during peak demand.

expected_impact.rationale: Top 10% revenue segment uses Premium vehicles.

vehicle_based.name: Economy Value Pricing
vehicle_based.description: Economy vehicles priced competitively to capture price-sensitive customers.

expected_impact.rationale: Capture price-sensitive segment Lyft might be losing.

supply_management.name: Critical Supply Shortage Surge
supply_management.description: When supply/demand ratio drops below 50%, trigger aggressive surge.

expected_impact.rationale: HWCO avg supply 43.8% vs Lyft 65.8%. Critical shortage issue.

supply_management.name: Healthy Supply Standard
supply_management.description: When supply/demand is healthy (65%+), standard pricing.

action.note: No surge needed when supply is adequate

expected_impact.rationale: Lyft maintains 65.8% supply. Target for HWCO.

competitive_response.name: Urban Price Match
competitive_response.description: Match Lyft urban pricing within 5% to prevent customer loss.

expected_impact.rationale: Urban is highest volume. Must stay competitive.

competitive_response.name: Rural Undercut
competitive_response.description: Undercut Lyft in Rural by 10% to capture market share.

expected_impact.rationale: Rural is underserved by Lyft. Opportunity to dominate.

event_based.name: Major Event Surge
event_based.description: Apply surge pricing for major events (sports, concerts, conferences).

expected_impact.rationale: Events cause demand spikes. Must capitalize.

event_based.name: Weather Event Adjustment
event_based.description: Adjust pricing during adverse weather conditions.

expected_impact.rationale: Weather increases demand and reduces supply. Pricing should reflect.
